title: Arifureta Shokugyou de Sekai Saikyou 2nd Season
content:
Arifureta Shokugyou de Sekai Saikyou Season 2 was a series that I had mixed feelings about. Having watched the first season and being underwhelmed by it, I was hesitant to give the second season a try. However, I decided to give it a chance and see if it could redeem itself, and while it did improve in some aspects, it still had many flaws.

One of the most noticeable improvements in this season was the animation quality. While it was still not on par with other shows in the same genre, it was definitely an improvement from the first season. The battles were more dynamic andthe character designs were more consistent. Additionally, the opening and ending themes were absolute bangers and I found myself jamming to them every time I heard them.

However, despite the animation being better, the characters were still one-dimensional and the plot was lackluster. Hajime, the protagonist, was still annoying and perverted, and while his backstory was explored more in-depth, it did little to make him a more likable character. The other characters in his group, while given some more development, still felt flat and uninteresting. The plot felt rushed and underdeveloped, with the writers seemingly cramming in as much action as possible without giving enough time for proper buildup. another issue with this season is the excessive amount of fan service, which is more annoying and perverted than I remembered from the previous season. It just felt like the show was trying too hard to pander to a certain audience rather than focusing on the plot and character development.

Overall, while Arifureta Shokugyou de Sekai Saikyou Season 2 had its moments, it still fell short of my expectations. The improved animation and music were a step in the right direction, but the weak characters and plot prevented me from fully enjoying the show. I would give this season a rating of 4.5/10, mainly because of the improvement in animation and the catchy opening and ending themes.

Overall: 4.5/10.
